meanings.def: brave and confident; not afraid to say what you feel or to take risks
examples: It was a bold move on their part to open a business in France.
The wine made him bold enough to approach her.
Highlight the important words in bold type.

meanings.def: that can be easily seen; having a strong clear appearance
examples: the bold outline of a mountain against the sky
She paints with bold strokes of the brush.
The furniture was painted in bold, primary colours.
a bold black and yellow sign

meanings.def: used especially when politely asking a question or making a suggestion which you hope will not offend anyone (although it may criticize them slightly)
examples: If I may be so bold as to suggest that he made a mistake in his calculations…

meanings.def: without showing any respect, shame or fear
examples: She marched in here, bold as brass, and demanded a pay rise.
